title: Stefan Białas
text:
Stefan Feliks Bialas (born 8 December 1948 in <a href="Siemianowice%20%C5%9Al%C4%85skie">Siemianowice Śląskie</a>) is a former <a href="Polish%20people">Polish</a> <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> player and manager.
He played for several Polish clubs, including Ruch Chorzów, Legia Warsaw and Śląsk Wrocław. He then moved to France and played for Gueugnon, Besançon, Nœux-les-Mines, Paris FC and Creil.
He later began a coaching career, first as assistant manager of Paris FC, then with <a href="AFC%20Compi%C3%A8gne">Compiègne</a>, <a href="AFC%20Creil">Creil</a>, <a href="AS%20Beauvais%20Oise">Beauvais</a>, <a href="Club%20Olympique%20des%20Transports">Club Olympique des Transports</a> and <a href="Stade%20Tunisien">Stade Tunisien</a>, and working briefly as a coach for Cracovia in 2006. On 12 May 2006 Bialas was appointed as the manager of Jagiellonia Białystok. On 7 June 2008 he mutually terminated his contract with the club. On 14 March 2010 he was officially named as the head coach of Legia Warsaw, where he was replaced by <a href="Maciej%20Skor%C5%BCa">Maciej Skorża</a> on 1 June 2010.
He has commentated for several <a href="Canal%20%2B">Canal +</a> during the <a href="Ligue%201">Ligue 1</a> matches.
